t: Psalm 107
BOOK FIVE: Psalms 107—150
Thanksgiving to the Lord for His Great Works of Deliverance
Oh,*pn give thanks to the Lord,*s for He*i is*i good! For*ld His mercy endures*i forever.
Let*ld the redeemed of the Lord*s say so,*i Whom*ld He has redeemed from the hand of the enemy,
And*ld gathered out of the lands, From*ld the east and from the west, From*ld the north and from the south.
They*ln wandered in the wilderness in a desolate way; They*ld found no city to dwell in.
Hungry*ld and thirsty, Their*ld soul fainted in them.
Then*ld they cried out to the Lord*s in their trouble, And*ild He delivered them out of their distresses.
And*ld He led them forth by the right way, That*ld they might go to a city for a dwelling place.
Oh,*ld that men*i would give thanks to the Lord*s for*i His goodness, And*ld for*i His wonderful works to the children of men!
For*ld He satisfies the longing soul, And*ld fills the hungry soul with goodness.
Those*ln who sat in darkness and in the shadow of death, Bound*ld in affliction and irons—
Because*ld they rebelled against the words of God, And*ld despised the counsel of the Most High,
Therefore*ld He brought down their heart with labor; They*ld fell down, and there*i was*i none to help.
Then*ld they cried out to the Lord*s in their trouble, And*ild He saved them out of their distresses.
He*ld brought them out of darkness and the shadow of death, And*ld broke their chains in pieces.
Oh,*ld that men*i would give thanks to the Lord*s for*i His goodness, And*ld for*i His wonderful works to the children of men!
For*ld He has broken the gates of bronze, And*ld cut the bars of iron in two.
Fools,*ln because of their transgression, And*ld because of their iniquities, were afflicted.
Their*ld soul abhorred all manner of food, And*ld they drew near to the gates of death.
Then*ld they cried out to the Lord*s in their trouble, And*ild He saved them out of their distresses.
He*ld sent His word and healed them, And*ld delivered them*i from their destructions.
Oh,*ld that men*i would give thanks to the Lord*s for*i His goodness, And*ld for*i His wonderful works to the children of men!
Let*ld them sacrifice the sacrifices of thanksgiving, And*ld declare His works with rejoicing.
Those*ln who go down to the sea in ships, Who*ld do business on great waters,
They*ld see the works of the Lord,*s And*ld His wonders in the deep.
For*ld He commands and raises the stormy wind, Which*ld lifts up the waves of the sea.
They*ld mount up to the heavens, They*ld go down again to the depths; Their*ld soul melts because of trouble.
They*ld reel to and fro, and stagger like a drunken man, And*ld are at their wits’ end.
Then*ld they cry out to the Lord*s in their trouble, And*ld He brings them out of their distresses.
He*ld calms the storm, So*ld that its waves are still.
Then*ld they are glad because they are quiet; So*ld He guides them to their desired haven.
Oh,*ld that men*i would give thanks to the Lord*s for*i His goodness, And*ld for*i His wonderful works to the children of men!
Let*ld them exalt Him also in the assembly of the people, And*ld praise Him in the company of the elders.
He*ln turns rivers into a wilderness, And*ld the watersprings into dry ground;
A*ld fruitful land into barrenness, For*ld the wickedness of those who dwell in it.
He*ld turns a wilderness into pools of water, And*ld dry land into watersprings.
There*ld He makes the hungry dwell, That*ld they may establish a city for a dwelling place,
And*ld sow fields and plant vineyards, That*ld they may yield a fruitful harvest.
He*ld also blesses them, and they multiply greatly; And*ld He does not let their cattle decrease.
When*ln they are diminished and brought low Through*ld oppression, affliction, and sorrow,
He*ld pours contempt on princes, And*ld causes them to wander in the wilderness where*i there*i is*i no way;
Yet*ld He sets the poor on high, far from affliction, And*ld makes their*i families like a flock.
The*ld righteous see it*i and rejoice, And*ld all iniquity stops its mouth.
Whoever*ln is*i wise will observe these things,*i And*ld they will understand the lovingkindness of the Lord.*s
